newsitem.title: UK: Gazprom shares surge on first day of London trade.
newsitem.headline: Gazprom shares surge on first day of London trade.

text.p: ADS shares in Russian energy giant RAO Gazprom surged to $18.50 by the close of trade in London on Tuesday after announcing a price of $15.75 for the American Depositary Shares the previous day. "I would not be surprised to see the ADS go over $20.00 once New York is in there," said the head of trading at a European bank.
Some investors believe that the ADS will show gains for some time yet, before profit taking sets in.
"The ADS could be frothy for some time, but then we will see what happens," said a fund manager.
The ADS had traded as high as $19.50 in morning trade in London and closed at a 264 percent premium to the underlying Gazprom stock which ended in Moscow at 50.5 cents, off a high of 53 cents.
Others traders say that the ADS has now found its trading level after hitting the $19.50 peak in early morning trade.
"There was a little bit of stock coming out after the high," said one trader.
However, a trader at a U.S. bank in New York said that he had been inundated with calls on the stock from investors.
Others say that Gazprom will entice foreign investors into other Russian stock, especially blue chip shares.
"It may take a day or so," said the trader at the European bank, "But we could see some of the money which had wanted Gazprom flowing in to other Russian shares which are traded overseas.
He cited oil giant LUKoil and electricity utility Mosenergo as potential beneficiaries of any overflow.
Both companies have American Depositary Receipt (ADRs) programmes and are listed on the over-the-counter markets in New York.
